title: HW2 Q5
content: Problem context: This is another old (and easy) exam problem. It is there to do three things: (1) Get you to learn on your own --- this wasn't covered in lecture or discussion. But you can do this without anything else besides the problem itself and thinking on your part. (2) Act as fair warning that we can ask you to tackle truly new material on the final itself. (3) Get you light exposure to some of the practical systems-oriented side thinking of how to deal with training when you have multiple machines and decide to split the training data among them. You want to be in a position (at least after this course) to be able to read and understand:https://jax-ml.github.io/scaling-book/You're not there yet. But this problem is meant to help you see that you don't need us to teach you this stuff in lecture itself. You can pick it up yourself.
document:
Problem context: 

This is another old (and easy) exam problem. It is there to do three things: (1) Get you to learn on your own --- this wasn't covered in lecture or discussion. But you can do this without anything else besides the problem itself and thinking on your part. (2) Act as fair warning that we can ask you to tackle truly new material on the final itself. (3) Get you light exposure to some of the practical systems-oriented side thinking of how to deal with training when you have multiple machines and decide to split the training data among them.  

You want to be in a position (at least after this course) to be able to read and understand:
https://jax-ml.github.io/scaling-book/

You're not there yet. But this problem is meant to help you see that you don't need us to teach you this stuff in lecture itself. You can pick it up yourself.
